titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Time Inc. Company Services Records
1969-1983
MS 3009-RG 53
titlestmt.author: Allen Thomas
titlestmt.sponsor: The processing of the Time Inc. Records was made possible by a generous grant from the Henry Luce Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 15:47:11 -0400.

did.abstract: Time Inc. Company Services was founded in the late 1940s to carry out functions not directly related to the production of Time Inc. magazines or other products. The collection consists of flight logs of an aircraft owned by Time Inc. and invoices for purchase of various items of office furniture and equipment.
did.physloc: Materials in this collection are stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
did.langmaterial: The materials in the collection are in English.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials in this collection are stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two series: Series I. Flight Logs; and Series II. Purchasing Department.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Time Inc. Company Services was founded in the late 1940s to carry out functions not directly related to the production of Time Inc. magazines or other products. It handled the internal telephone network in Time Inc. buildings, purchasing of furniture and other office equipment, reception of mail, and at some points business travel arrangements for Time Inc. employees.
Citation: Time Inc. Reference Files, MS 3009-RG 3, New-York Historical Society

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: This record group should be cited as Time Inc. Company Service Records, MS 3009-RG 53, New-York Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Time Inc. Company Services Records were processed by Allen Thomas in 2020. The original folders were retained although some documents were transferred to archival containers in instances of overcrowding. Allen Thomas created the inventory and other descriptive notes to produce this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: This finding aid relates to just one record group of the Time Inc. Records. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the Time Inc. Records (MS 3009). The Henry Luce Papers (MS 3014) were acquired with the Time Inc. Records. The collection of books acquired with the records are cataloged as the Time Inc. Reference Library. Additional materials about Time Inc. Company Services can be found in the the Time Inc. Subject Files (MS 3009-RG 1) and Time Inc. Reference Files (MS 3009-RG 3).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of flight logs of an aircraft owned by Time Inc. and invoices for purchase of various items of office furniture and equipment.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.

Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.

Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions

controlaccess.subject: Corporations -- History.
Corporations -- New York (State) -- New York.
Publishers and publishing -- New York (State) -- New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I consists of two identical copies of flight logs for an aircraft owned by Time Inc. The plane was designated #N4764R.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I is in original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II consists of invoices for purchase of various items of office furniture and equipment.
